extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 to 3 cloves garlic, peeled and minced

extendedIngredients.name: green onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 to 3 stalks green onions, cut into 4-inch lengths

extendedIngredients.name: napa cabbage leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small napa cabbage, ends trimmed and leaves separated

extendedIngredients.name: rice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 5 to 6 cups water or rice washing

extendedIngredients.name: bokchoy
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 bunch bokchoy, ends trimmed and leaves separated

extendedIngredients.name: mudfish
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 whole mudfish, gutted, scaled, cleaned and cut into serving parts

recipes.title: Pesang Dalag (Mudfish In Ginger Broth)
recipes.instructions: Season fish with salt and pepper to taste. In a skillet, heat about 1-inch of oil on medium heat. Fry fish, turning once or twice, until lightly brown. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels.In another pan, heat about 1-inch of oil over medium heat. Deep-fry potatoes until lightly brown and tender. Remove from heat and drain on paper towels.In a pot, heat about 1 tablespoon of oil. Add onions, garlic and ginger and cook for about 2 to 3 minutes or until fragrant. Add fish sauce and continue to cook, stirring occasionally, for about 1 to 2 minutes.Add water and bring to a boil. Add fish and potatoes and cook for about 5 to 7 minutes or until fish and potatoes are fully cooked through. Add pechay and cabbage and continue to cook for about 2 to 3 minutes or until vegetables are tender yet crisp. Add green onions and continue for about another 30 seconds. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

steps.step: Season fish with salt and pepper to taste. In a skillet, heat about 1-inch of oil on medium heat. Fry fish, turning once or twice, until lightly brown.
Remove from pan and drain on paper towels.In another pan, heat about 1-inch of oil over medium heat. Deep-fry potatoes until lightly brown and tender.
Remove from heat and drain on paper towels.In a pot, heat about 1 tablespoon of oil.
Add onions, garlic and ginger and cook for about 2 to 3 minutes or until fragrant.
Add fish sauce and continue to cook, stirring occasionally, for about 1 to 2 minutes.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Add fish and potatoes and cook for about 5 to 7 minutes or until fish and potatoes are fully cooked through.
Add pechay and cabbage and continue to cook for about 2 to 3 minutes or until vegetables are tender yet crisp.
Add green onions and continue for about another 30 seconds. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
